resources.string:
"Android Developer

" "Looking for a challenging
" "software engineering internship
" "with personal/professional development"
B.S. in Computer Science and Mathematics
Jeffrey S. Raikes School of Computer Science and Management
Honors Program: Jeffrey S. Raikes School of Computer Science and Management

"A selective interdisciplinary school integrating innovative business concepts into a traditional computer science curriculum with emphasis on practical and real-world experience taught through group projects."
Alpha Lambda Delta and Phi Eta Signma Honor Socieities
Raikes School Student Advisory Board Treasurer
Out of the Darkness Assistant Logistics Coordinator
33 ACT, AP Scholar, 2015 Outstanding Senior Award by the Omaha West Rotary Club
"National Honor Society (President), Senior Senate (Treasurer), Varsity Marching Band (Low Brass Section Leader), Academic Decathlon (Tester)"
2015 Outstanding Senior Award by the Omaha West Rotary Club
Varsity Marching Band (Low Brass Section Leader)
Leading the testing efforts of our product design capstone project, while engaging in agile processes and developing real software for sports analytics company, Hudl.

Developed a way for users to share photos to enhance their social experience on Garmin’s Android application, Connect, as the feature’s only Android developer, while contributing to other products and features.
Programmed using Java in Android Studio, gaining a vast amount of knowledge on Android and its components.
Worked closely with API, implementing endpoint and HTTP calls using background threads.
Familiarized myself with Glide, a largely used image loader library recommended by Google.
Engaged in agile methodologies such as iteration, release candidate and sprint planning, and code freezes.
Participated in CodeU, an exclusive virtual development program for high potential undergraduate students.
Worked remotely with a small group of peers to design and build a software project with regular code reviews and guidance from a Google engineer.
Implemented data persistence with MongoDB, storing user, conversation, and message data on Mongo Atlas for our desktop Java chat application.
Exposure to MVC architecture and password encryption.
Attended exclusive YouTube Live Career Series hosted by Google recruiters and engineers, covering industry and career preparation topics.

Worked side-by-side with talented Developers, Designers, and Product Managers every day ensuring customers would use their software by writing automated regression and load tests and manually testing across all platforms.
Wrote Python scripts for automated tests using the Selenium and Appium automation frameworks.
Discovered and audited 6 months’ worth of lost public video, leading to more accurate historical analytical business data.
Advised and developed new features from day one with daily team discussions and goal planning.
Communicated and documented software issues using Trello and Atlassian tools such as Jira and Confluence.
First Android project meant to familiarize myself with Google Material Design.
Source code can be found at https://github.com/JacobWarner/ResumeApp

As part of the Google CodeU program, I was given the framework of a desktop chat application in Java to develop my coding and software engineering skills. My job was to implement data persistence, which I chose to do through MongoDB.
Source code can be found at https://github.com/JacobWarner/codeu_project_2017
